pr_title: feat: add five, ten and twenty minutes sleep timer extend buttons

timeline.author: ByteHamster

replies.bodyText: Been doing too much Python lately, sorry 😆
replies.author: max-wittig

timeline.bodyText: Wouldn't wrap_content without layout_weight be easier here? Or am I overlooking something?
timeline.author: ByteHamster
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -50,19 +50,46 @@
             android:visibility="gone">
 
         <TextView
-                android:text="00:00:00"
-                android:layout_gravity="center"
-                android:textSize="32sp"
-                android:textColor="?android:attr/textColorPrimary"
-                android:layout_width="wrap_content"
-                android:layout_height="wrap_content"
-                android:id="@+id/time"/>
+            android:text="00:00:00"
+            android:layout_gravity="center"
+            android:textSize="32sp" 
+            android:textColor="?android:attr/textColorPrimary"
+            android:layout_width="wrap_content"
+            android:layout_height="wrap_content"
+            android:id="@+id/time"/>
 
         <Button
-                android:text="@string/disable_sleeptimer_label"
-                android:layout_width="match_parent"
+            android:text="@string/disable_sleeptimer_label"
+            android:layout_width="match_parent"
+            android:layout_height="wrap_content"
+            android:id="@+id/disableSleeptimerButton"/>
+            
+        <LinearLayout
+            android:layout_width="match_parent"
+            android:layout_height="0dp"

replies.bodyText: Then the buttons would all have different sizes, which I wanted to prevent. What do you think?
replies.author: max-wittig

replies.bodyText: Do you mean width or height of the buttons? For the width, I think it should be something like weight_sum here instead of layout_weight.
replies.author: ByteHamster

replies.bodyText:
I ment the width. Android Studio suggested that I should set the height to 0dp, as I'm using layout_weight.
But I'm not too familar with Android anymore, it's. been over three years for me so maybe you could add this as code suggestion directly? That would be helpful.
replies.author: max-wittig

timeline.bodyText: Like @keunes wrote, this should be a string resource. Making it as generic as he said would be great but I would also merge the simpler approach that just creates two independent strings because keunes' approach requires some Java code as well.

replies.bodyText: I've used @keunes approach now. Is that okay?
replies.author: max-wittig

timeline.bodyText: Please have a quick look at our new code style guide for resource names: https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/wiki/Code-style#resource-id-naming

replies.author: max-wittig

timeline.bodyText: 5dp and 2dp are rather unusual for Material Design. It normally uses multiples of 4dp. Why is the padding needed?

timeline.message:
refactor(sleep_timer): move buttons to local variables

Suggested by Android Studio

refactor(time_dialog): use material design spacing

As suggested by @ByteHamster
feat: add five and ten minutes sleep timer extend buttons

fix(time_dialog): add borderless button style

This removes the warning that occurs otherwise in Android Studio

fix(time_dialog): expand TextView to match parent

This prevents the TextView from resizing, while counting down
feat(time_dialog): add 20 min button, use localized strings

refactor(sleep_timer): move buttons to local variables

Suggested by Android Studio
refactor(sleep_timer): use Java style variables
refactor(time_dialog): conform to view names

refactor(time_dialog): use material design spacing

As suggested by @ByteHamster

refactor(time_dialog): use material design spacing

As suggested by @ByteHamster
style(time_dialog): use previous indent style
style(time_dialog): use previous indent style
style(time_dialog): use previous indent style
style(time_dialog): use previous indent style

timeline.bodyText:
I think it should be enough to just use:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                            android:layout_height="0dp"
          
          
            
                            android:layout_weight="1"
          
          
            
                            android:layout_height="wrap_content"
          
      
    
    
  

and then use android:layout_weight in the children (like you already do). You can use 1 for each child - no need to end up with a total of 1.
timeline.author: ByteHamster

timeline.message:
fix(time_dialog): do not use weight for parent

Co-authored-by: ByteHamster <ByteHamster@users.noreply.github.com>
fix(time_dialog): set weight of children to 1
fix(time_dialog): use suggested style

timeline.bodyText: Could you please indent those with more spaces, so that the file uses consistent indention? I know it's different in different files but we should at least try to keep one scheme per file.
timeline.author: ByteHamster

replies.bodyText: I've indented it with 8 spaces now.
replies.author: max-wittig

timeline.bodyText: Please use tools:text here to make it clear that it is only used for the layout preview and that the actual text is set using Java.
timeline.author: ByteHamster
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -64,6 +65,45 @@
                 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
                 android:id="@+id/disableSleeptimerButton"/>
 
+        <LinearLayout
+                android:layout_width="match_parent"
+                android:layout_height="wrap_content"
+                android:orientation="horizontal">
+
+            <Button
+                android:id="@+id/extendSleepFiveMinutesButton"
+                style="?attr/materialButtonOutlinedStyle"
+                android:layout_width="0dp"
+                android:layout_height="wrap_content"
+                android:layout_marginEnd="4dp"
+                android:layout_marginRight="4dp"
+                android:layout_weight="1"
+                android:padding="5dp"
+                android:text="+5 min" />
